intro: Meconella oregana, commonly known as the Oregon meconella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Meconella oregana is often found in the Pacific Northwest and is an important component of local ecosystems.
